tr.td:
Types of resource (if a resource reference)
ResourceType ( Required)

short.value: A Search Parameter that defines a named search item that can be used to search/filter on a resource.

definition.value: A Search Parameter that defines a named search item that can be used to search/filter on a resource.

short.value: The logical id of the resource, as used in the url for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

definition.value: The logical id of the resource, as used in the url for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

short.value: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

definition.value: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

short.value: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.

definition.value: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.

short.value: The base language in which the resource is written.

definition.value: The base language in which the resource is written.

short.value: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

definition.value: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

short.value: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

definition.value: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

short.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

short.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

short.value: An absolute URL at which this search parameter is (or will be) published, and which is used to reference this profile in conformance statements.

definition.value: An absolute URL at which this search parameter is (or will be) published, and which is used to reference this profile in conformance statements.

requirements.value: To allow referencing and reusing search parameter definitions under other names on operational systems (in case of name clash).

short.value: The name of the standard or custom search parameter.

definition.value: The name of the standard or custom search parameter.

short.value: The name of the individual or organization that published the search parameter.

definition.value: The name of the individual or organization that published the search parameter.

requirements.value: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the search parameter. May also allow for contact.

short.value: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

definition.value: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

short.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

short.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

short.value: The name of an individual to contact regarding the search parameter.

definition.value: The name of an individual to contact regarding the search parameter.

short.value: Contact details for individual (if a name was provided) or the publisher.

definition.value: Contact details for individual (if a name was provided) or the publisher.

short.value: The Scope and Usage that this search parameter was created to meet.

definition.value: The Scope and Usage that this search parameter was created to meet.

short.value: The status of this search parameter definition.

definition.value: The status of this search parameter definition.

description.value: The lifecycle status of a Value Set or Concept Map

short.value: A flag to indicate that this search parameter definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

definition.value: A flag to indicate that this search parameter definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

short.value: The date (and optionally time) when the search parameter definition was published.

definition.value: The date (and optionally time) when the search parameter definition was published.

short.value: The base resource type that this search parameter refers to.

definition.value: The base resource type that this search parameter refers to.

description.value: One of the resource types defined as part of FHIR

short.value: The type of value a search parameter refers to, and how the content is interpreted.

definition.value: The type of value a search parameter refers to, and how the content is interpreted.

description.value: Data types allowed to be used for search parameters

short.value: A description of the search parameters and how it used.

definition.value: A description of the search parameters and how it used.

short.value: An XPath expression that returns a set of elements for the search parameter.

definition.value: An XPath expression that returns a set of elements for the search parameter.

short.value: Types of resource (if a resource is referenced).

definition.value: Types of resource (if a resource is referenced).

description.value: One of the resource types defined as part of FHIR

short.value: A Search Parameter that defines a named search item that can be used to search/filter on a resource.

definition.value: A Search Parameter that defines a named search item that can be used to search/filter on a resource.

short.value: An absolute URL at which this search parameter is (or will be) published, and which is used to reference this profile in conformance statements.

definition.value: An absolute URL at which this search parameter is (or will be) published, and which is used to reference this profile in conformance statements.

requirements.value: To allow referencing and reusing search parameter definitions under other names on operational systems (in case of name clash).

short.value: The name of the standard or custom search parameter.

definition.value: The name of the standard or custom search parameter.

short.value: The name of the individual or organization that published the search parameter.

definition.value: The name of the individual or organization that published the search parameter.

requirements.value: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the search parameter. May also allow for contact.

short.value: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

definition.value: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

short.value: The name of an individual to contact regarding the search parameter.

definition.value: The name of an individual to contact regarding the search parameter.

short.value: Contact details for individual (if a name was provided) or the publisher.

definition.value: Contact details for individual (if a name was provided) or the publisher.

short.value: The Scope and Usage that this search parameter was created to meet.

definition.value: The Scope and Usage that this search parameter was created to meet.

short.value: The status of this search parameter definition.

definition.value: The status of this search parameter definition.

description.value: The lifecycle status of a Value Set or Concept Map

short.value: A flag to indicate that this search parameter definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

definition.value: A flag to indicate that this search parameter definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

short.value: The date (and optionally time) when the search parameter definition was published.

definition.value: The date (and optionally time) when the search parameter definition was published.

short.value: The base resource type that this search parameter refers to.

definition.value: The base resource type that this search parameter refers to.

description.value: One of the resource types defined as part of FHIR

short.value: The type of value a search parameter refers to, and how the content is interpreted.

definition.value: The type of value a search parameter refers to, and how the content is interpreted.

description.value: Data types allowed to be used for search parameters

short.value: A description of the search parameters and how it used.

definition.value: A description of the search parameters and how it used.

short.value: An XPath expression that returns a set of elements for the search parameter.

definition.value: An XPath expression that returns a set of elements for the search parameter.

short.value: Types of resource (if a resource is referenced).

definition.value: Types of resource (if a resource is referenced).

description.value: One of the resource types defined as part of FHIR
